body: Thanks for reporting this ! I will help review your fixing PR.

The `log_params` limit the param value length <= 250 at here:
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/8693a26bf2acd418aa93aa5ea2e5536caa199fc3/mlflow/utils/validation.py#L148

@dbczumar 

Which param value length limitation shall we use ?

* `log_param` doc say value length limitation is 5000, but the code does not valiate the value length.
* `log_params` validate the value length to be <= 250, otherwise raise error
* `autologging` automatically truncate value to be length <= 250

If I may... I see at least two reasons why not 250: 1) consistency, so `log_params` should allow the user to achieve the same as `log_param`. 2) 250 seems too low, e.g. in the case of parameter vectors of doubles it would only allow very short vectors after stringification.
Yea, 250 is too low, we can consider to increase it. And we should add the same value length limit validation for `log_param`.  @dbczumar WDYT ?

@johnyNJ Would you create PR according to @dbczumar 's proposal above ? 
Or if you have better idea you can also raise it here.

<!-- assign-maintainer -->
@BenWilson2 @dbczumar @harupy @WeichenXu123 Please assign a maintainer and start triaging this issue.
